instruction.value: May repeat if needed for abdominal distention.
Administer by continuous infusion. Titrate dose according to patient response.
Administer by continuous infusion. Adjust rate as required to achieve desired outcome.
Administer by continuous infusion, Titrate to blood pressure response.

Initiate continuous infusion at 0.0005 unit/kg/hour and titrate dose by doubling rate every 30 minutes until the urine osmolality is twice that of plasma, and the urine output is less than 2 mL/kg/hour.
Initiate continuous infusion at 0.0005 unit/kg/hour and titrate dose by doubling rate every 30 minutes based upon serum and urine sodium and osmolality, plus fluid balance and urine output.
Initiate continuous infusion at 0.002 to 0.005 unit/kg/minute and titrate dose to a maximum of 0.01 unit/kg/minute.

additionalnotes.value: Once bleeding stops for 12 hours, taper off infusions 24 to 48 hours.
